title: Govt. likely to lose its majority in few days, will form a new govt.: Maithri Gunaratne
body_lines: Due to the ongoing protests at the Galle Gace Green, the current government is likely to lose its majority in a few days and form a new government, Former Governor and President's Counsel Maithri Gunaratne said, addressing a meeting in Galle today.

He said due to this continous protest, the finance minister who was involved in a fraud resigned, the Central Bank (CB) governor resigned, the Finance Ministry Secretary resigned, and all communities were reunited, showing that the opposition had gone into a deep sleep.
Moreover, he said the protestors had started the impeachment motion to be filed by the opposition.
"The work which was unable to be done by the government and the opposition has been done by the protestors successfully," Gunaratne said.
First of all, a new government should be formed, and later a new prime minister and a new cabinet should be appointed, he said.

The government is putting people from their side and from the police, to stop these struggles. Gunaratne said the government is making various attempts to sabotage the struggle started by the people. (Chaturanga Samarawickrama)
